lexUnit.name: appreciate.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: value somebody or something for a quality possessed

sentence.text: The final qualification is that a print-maker , to reach the very top of the tree , must be known and appreciated by the Japanese .
Your knowledge of the issues and your diligence in pursuing them to ensure protection of both the built and natural environments , is greatly admired and appreciated by us all .
He wanted to watch his wife 's mouth move because it was a mouth he 'd come to appreciate more and more .
He gave art an openly political meaning and did not appreciate the artist as an individual dissenting voice .
He began to appreciate his wife a little for her lack of romance and her low cost .
I started playing when I was seven , so by the time The Stones happened it was not difficult for me to play , so I could appreciate it for the music alone .
Take my advice , appreciate this ride for what it is -- a cultural experience -- and try to relax . "
I think he should appreciate you for what you are -- an attractive young woman of today . "
Elisabeth finished pouring and the activity took long enough for it to strike her that the Hulsbys were the sort of tourists who only appreciate sites for which postcards have been printed .
You appreciate the modelling in faces .
But I still appreciate good manners in men .
I appreciate the high taste in satorial elegance for which my hon. Friend is well known .
I just think it is , in fact , a great shame that the M P only acknowledges some letters if they happen to have the kind of status that he appreciates .
Hymns , chants etc. should be sung through fully and appreciated as prayer in themselves .
Alick will always be remembered and appreciated for his energy , enthusiasm , experience and encouragement by all who knew him .
The business did very well with the two lads greatly appreciated locally for their hard work and quality of service .
But often we are unwilling to let the other person know what we prefer or appreciate in their attitude and behaviour .
What did your father appreciate most in the work of Modigliani ?
Reynolds attacks the notion that application of rules will get a critic very far in appreciating ` sublime beauties in works of genius " .
Soon after the publication of Dole 's article , the US administration announced that President George Bush had read and " appreciated " it .
No one who seriously appreciates sport believes that even the most overtly physical sports are founded solely on physiological characteristics .
But you do not have to be a fusion buff to appreciate Joan Bromberg 's history of an important part of science .
You 've really got to be one to appreciate the spirit of the place but pop in to see what a real pub should be like .
We do appreciate you Steffi , for everything you have done over the years and for that special week in Brighton .
She said she was sure that someone as sensitive and intelligent as you are -- you see she does appreciate you , darling -- that you would surely be all right here .
